alert.note: Alert for Dade (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 6:59PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Walker and central Dade Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Rising Fawn, or 9 miles southwest of Trenton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Trenton, Chickamauga, Fairview, Rising Fawn, Noble, Chattanooga Valley, Cloudland Canyon State Park, Cooper Heights and Rock Spring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
